class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.SaxParser
class.comment:
A parser that sequentially reads a stream and raises events at the beginning and end of each element. The StartElement includes the following parameters: Uri - Namespace Uri, or empty string if there is no namespace. Name - The element name. Attributes - An Attributes object holding the element's attributes.
The EndElement includes the following parameters: Uri - Namespace Uri, or empty string if there is no namespace. Name - The element name. Text - The element text (if such exists).
class.event: StartElement (Uri As String, Name As String, Attributes As Attributes)
EndElement (Uri As String, Name As String, Text As StringBuilder)

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the object. Usually this object should be a process global object.

method.name: Parse2
method.comment: Parses the given TextReader. EventName - The events subs name prefix.

method.name: Parse
method.comment: Parses the given InputStream. EventName - The events subs name prefix.

field.name: Parents
field.comment: A list that holds the names of the parents elements. During parsing you can use this list to recognize the current element.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.SaxParser.AttributesWrapper
class.comment: This object is passed in StartElement event.

method.name: GetValue2
method.comment: Returns the value of the attribute with the following Uri and Name. Pass an empty string as the Uri if namespaces are not used. Returns an empty string if no such attribute was found.

method.name: GetValue
method.comment: Returns the value of the attribute at the specified index. Note that the order of elements can change.

method.name: GetName
method.comment: Returns the name of the attribute at the specified index. Note that the order of elements can change.

property.name: Size
property.comment: Returns the number of attributes in this element.

root.comment: This library provides an XML Sax Parser. See this <link>tutorial|http://www.basic4ppc.com/forum/basic4android-getting-started-tutorials/6866-xml-parsing-xmlsax-library.html</link> for a working example.
